Vance, Trump's heir apparent, defends his Christian nationalism at Turning Point conference
subhead: The US vice president gave the closing speech at the Turning Point USA conference in Phoenix on December 21. He followed Donald Trump's line, all while spouting ideological rhetoric rooted in Christian nationalism. He told the audience: 'You don't have to apologize for being White anymore.'

Gaza: The Latin patriarch of Jerusalem honors Christians, who remain 'steadfast' in a 'sea of destruction'
subhead: Cardinal Pierbattista Pizzaballa, head of the Catholic Church in the Holy Land, made another visit to the Gaza Strip to celebrate Christmas Mass. The vast majority of the Christian community, now down to just 600 people, is still sheltering within the parish.

title: Denmark summons US ambassador after Trump names Greenland envoy
subhead: Donald Trump announced early Monday that he had named the governor of Louisiana, Jeff Landry, as US special envoy to Greenland. 'It's an honour to serve you in this volunteer position to make Greenland a part of the US,' Landry responded.

title: Celebrate the season with Le Monde in English's most beloved holiday movies
subhead: We rounded up our favorite flicks to return to every December, from Christmas classics like 'Elf' and 'The Muppet Christmas Carol' to more unexpected picks such as 'E.T.' and 'Cool Runnings.'

title: Disneyland Paris at 40: When Mickey Mouse said 'bonjour' to Paris
subhead: On December 18, 1985, the Walt Disney Company approved the construction of its first European theme park in Marne-la-Vallée, about 30 kilometers east of Paris. The prime minister secured the deal after tough negotiations between envoys from the Socialist government and an American corporation seen as the embodiment of ruthless capitalism.

Madagascar's metalheads lead charge of anger: 'It's easier to make yourself heard when you scream'
subhead: After three weeks of protest, Madagascar's Generation Z succeeded in toppling those in power on October 14. The uprising drew much of its strength from countercultural circles, chief among them the island's vibrant metal scene. Heirs to a long tradition, Madagascar's metalheads condemn poverty, inequality and the regime's incompetence.

title: BHV department store boss Frédéric Merlin fails to buy iconic Parisian store's building from Galeries Lafayette
subhead: According to Galeries Lafayette, the acquisition will be carried out by 'an anglophone player with recognized expertise in real estate asset management.'

title: Lumpy skin disease: Farmers demand vaccines and reject culling
subhead: After vaccination zones and a protection zone were implemented in the Occitanie region of southern France, concern is now growing in the Aveyron. The department, home to 500,000 cattle, has the largest herd in the region, with half of them being the Aubrac breed.
